Erza has had a difficult past. Her family, historically with many wizards who studied magic that was forbidden in the kingdom of Ryderia, are now just moderate merchants with one large estate. Though not exactly the apple of her parents' eye, her Nana always encouraged her to be herself and to pursue her own interests, despite her feeling like an outsider among her peers.

Eventually, she studied magic hard enough to be able to gain entry to Baloch Mahar University in the south. Her Nana paid for the travel and deposit so Erza could study in the South, unimpeded by the archaic laws in the North. Over many years, and overcoming some prejudice, she has risen to the position of Head Librarian of the Shamayilm library at the university.

As a hugely respected member of the community, Erza has risen incredibly far in arcane academia, but she still struggles a little in her personal interactions. Her boss and (only real friend) is Master Sage Parma - a fairy who oversees much of the magical research at Baloch Univserity.

Youngest of the prime branch of the Nai'igal family, Aramil grew up wealthy and spoilt. With little chance of inheriting the large family seats, he was tutored in the ways of a warrior to further the family's secret goals.

For generations, the Nai'igal's, in exchange for power and riches, have been doing the bidding of a demon named Rakasha, doing her bidding in the material plane. Aramil failed consistently in his studies, despite being intelligent and strong, as he was undisciplined and unmotivated, instead choosing a life of hedonism.

During a moment of apathy, Aramil inadvertently started a fire in one of the family vaults at which he was training, killing his instructor and destroying many relics in the process. His parents, after a stern discussion where Aramil refused to change his ways, shipped him to Baloch to study at the unversity, effectively cutting him off and washing their hands of his poor attitude and lack of interest in the family's values.

The life of a student (and likely a merchant or mercenary thereafter) is not one that suits Aramil. Willing to do anything to find favour with his family again and return to a lavish lifestlye, he is using his spare time from his studies looking for any artefacts that could serve Rakasha's mysterious goals. Oddly, however, he is for the first time finding enjoyment in his studies and having an element of stucture in his life.

Aroz is native to the city of Baloch and grew up in one of the city's slums (dragonborn not born into nobility are often stuck in a cycle of poverty).

Forced to survive on very little, they are a nimble and dextrous individual, and they got by on charming and swindling the wealthy. With some friends in the criminal underworld of the city, they know shortcuts and secret passageways in many places throughout the city and are able to find new ones in new places easily.

By happenstance, Aroz swiped an agate ring from a noble whose interest they had piqued (aged 15 - adult age for Dragonborn). The ring held an imprisoned efreeti djinn named Arafat, whom Aroz was able to free.

Grateful for the freedom, and feeling kinship towards Aroz as an efreeti dragonborn, Arafat granted Aroz powerful abilities (and Meena - a raven-sized summer cardinal which acts as a familiar), a result of which they were able to talk themselves into a position at the university to escape their position.

Aroz now studies at the university, doing little studying (yet somehow still passing), partying, socialising and gallivanting for the most part! They occasionally source high-quality food-stuffs for Arafat at his request.

Son of the king of the Northern nation of Ryderia, Doryan has had the life of a fairy-tale character (but only the worst bits).

His father, busy with matters of the kingdoms and battles against neighbouring nations, was not too involved in hus life so his step-mother "raised" him from the age of 5. She never really cared for him, although she never really outwardly treated him unkindly.

However, unbeknownst to the king and Doryan, she was secretly looking for any way to get the crown to pass to her own son. When Doryan was 17, discovering himself and more about the world, he fell in love with one of the stable boys at the castle.

His step-mother discovered this, thanks to many spies and paiges that she had paid off. Revealing this "sin" (as the more primitive Northern nations would call it), Doryan was exiled for shaming the family.

Cast into the wild on his own, he was spoken to in a dream by the goddess Talee. She bestowed him with special abilities so that he could survive in the wilderness. Somehow, he travelled for years and made it to the city of Baloch, where he has now dwelled for some years, serving at one of Talee's biggest temples in the Southern kingdoms.

Bought up in the remote druidic enclave near the village of Layesha, Jefar always felt a little bored. The community of druids, including his 5 polyamorous parental unit, were content to just exist at one with nature.

Jefar, on the other hand, had a flare for the dramatics. Known at school for his dramatic retelling of stories and musical talent. He would put together creative outfits, sing and perform to the joy of the other students and his teachers.
At the half-orc maturation age of 15, he decided to depart his village (with the blessing of his parents - starting with birth parent Radika "Riri") and join a performing trope.

He has since found a troop of drag queens that perform and retell ancient stories, as well as gawdy and occasionally lewd musical numbers, under the name Maleeka Sharara. She has a gentle rivalry with her fellow queen Mita Jamri.
Performing in Baloch for the past few weeks, he has now gotten to know a few of the residents of the city and made some friends, though he will soon have to be on the road again...
